content.description: Climb up the ramp on the left to clip the first bolt. From here, walk up the ramp until you find a start that is to your liking! If you are under 5.8", it might be a little easier to start on the crimps about 4 feet to the left of the first bolt and traverse at an angle on crimps to the second bolt. Both ways are about equal, depending on your height. The first 30 feet of this route climb very nicely on crimps and sidepulls. You are rewarded with a 5.6 warm down for the last 15 feet to get to the top.
content.location:
This is just left of

Pete's Kitchen

.

content.description: From the start, this climb is a little aggressive with small holds and not the greatest feet, but after you establish yourself on the wall it has some nice movement for the first half. Reward yourself on the second half with easy climbing to the anchors.
content.location:
This is the first route to the right of

Waffle House

.

content.description: Morning Wood is a great way to start the day.... It starts with a little boulder problem to establish the ramp, and from there you pull on small crimps until you get to easier terrain. Tons of fun!
content.location:
This route is just right of

Morning Poos

and left of

Waffle House

.

content.description:
This line goes right of

The Diner

going into the dihedral just right.  It probably is not worth the effort

even if you were curious and didn't look at it from below

, but it does have a bit of an interesting traverse reminiscent of

Rewritten's

traverse in reverse.  That can be done if one felt put off by the difficulty in protecting the move out onto the face of

The Diner

; however, you'll probably lack a large piece like an old #4 Camalot or larger to protect the traverse to keep it from being PG-13.
content.protection: A light rack up to an old #4 or 4.5 Camalot.
content.location:
This starts as for

The Diner

but veers right on the obvious traverse and around the corner.

content.description: The morning poos! This route is a lot of fun whether you're looking to get your first lead, warm up, or doing some climbing to get the morning started. Tricky movements lead to good stances where you can plan out your next move.
content.location: This is currently the leftmost route on the wall.

content.description: After some easy climbing in a 3-4 inch sideways crack, climb up left and around the corner and place gear in a 0.5-1 inch seam, a green Camalot works very well here. Pull the crux finger lock to get to some good holds. Be creative on a few gear placements.
content.protection:
Small sizes to #3 Camalot. Sling for a tree at the top or climb to the left and rappel off the anchors of

Pete's Kitchen

.
content.location:
The route starts in the obvious corner to the right of

Pete's Kitchen

.
